intro: Polycarpaea divaricata var. latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf polycarpaea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate to elliptic leaves that are often broad and glossy. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, attracting various pollinators. This variant is distinguished by its broader leaves compared to the typical form of the species.
